column1: '''Cold Be Hand and Heart and Bone
column3: sung by a [[Barrow-wight|barrow-wight]] in the [[Fog on the Barrow-downs]] chapter of [[The Fellowship of the Ring]].<ref>{{FR|I8}}</ref>

column1: ==Text==
<poem>
''Cold be hand and heart and bone
''and cold be sleep under stone:''
''never more to wake on stony bed
''never
column2: till the Sun fails and the Moon is dead.''

column1: ''In the black wind the stars shall die
''and still on gold here let them lie
''till the dark lord lifts up his hand''
''over dead sea and withered land.''
</poem>
==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2002:'' [[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'''''
:[[Gollum]] recites a few lines from the poem with some altered lyrics; they go as follows:
<poem>
''Cold be heart and hand and bone
''Cold be travelers far from home
''They do not see what lies ahead''
''when sun has failed and moon is dead.''
</poem>
'''2002:'' [[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)]]'''''
:One can hear a disembodied voice reciting the incantation in the background during Frodo's battle with the Barrow-wight.
